comments.body: [The documentation](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables#column-options) says `setCellProps` returns a `string`. Can you back this with a code snippet from the library? I based my typings primarily on the documentation.
I opened a PR to fix it in the documentation as well. It has been merged 10 hours ago :)
I see it: https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/pull/431. Approving review.
Is it correct that this is no longer an array?

Yes, see this [example](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/master/examples/column-filters/index.js) for details, also mentioned in the [readme](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables) (see filterOptions in options table for column ). The string array with options moved into an object i called MUIDataTableFilterOptions with new settings `display ` and `logic`. As said: I'm not sure about the exact typing of especially display.
I see em, suggested a better typing for `logic` below. I don't think much more can be done for `display` unless they properly document their typings.

```suggestion

```

comments.body:
shuld stay optional IMO:
https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/3ae8302d4c006ee47f951ac0ba113b7fb1b0eba2/src/MUIDataTable.js#L1258
https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/3ae8302d4c006ee47f951ac0ba113b7fb1b0eba2/src/MUIDataTable.js#L195
```suggestion
    onFilterChange?: (changedColumn: string, filterList: any[], type: FilterType | 'chip' | 'reset') => void;
```
https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/02980525e1cb72cc895fa73ad3504567855fab3c/test/MUIDataTableFilter.test.js#L32

although `filterData` and `filterList` are initially an empty array, both are populated as a 2D array of strings on [`buildColumns()`](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/d50ff23334c28035a244233b844501f89afddf7e/src/MUIDataTable.js#L647-L648)
`filterData` was not included in typings but is present [here](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/master/src/components/TableFilter.js#L326)
`onChange` is passed [`handleCustomChange()`](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/master/src/components/TableFilter.js#L151), which can receive either a string or array of strings

comments.body:
- `null` [when resetting filters](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/master/src/MUIDataTable.js#L1372)
- If a column has `filterType: 'custom'` it is passed a `MUIDataTableColumn`
- Lastly, a regular column is passed a string of the column name

comments.body: [`searchText` is null](https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/d50ff23334c28035a244233b844501f89afddf7e/src/MUIDataTable.js#L1326) when the search field is closed (`this.state.searchText` becomes null)

@Patrick-Erichsen Could you please explain this change? My team has been using the `customBodyRender` function successfully thus far with `number` and `boolean` values. 

See this example from the mui-datatables repo, where between Lines 60-98, the column options are found for the **Salary** and **Active** columns. The **Salary** column contains number values, and the **Active** column contains boolean values.
Also note on Line 91 that the `updateValue()` function can receive a non-string type value (in this case, a boolean).
https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blob/master/examples/component/index.js#L60-L98

Thanks for taking a closer look at these updates and linking those examples! I'm AFK this weekend but will give a more thorough response Monday.

When making these type changes, I was attempting to pass an object to `customBodyRender` and getting a `.toString()` version of my object passed as a param. I ended up stringifying/parsing my object to pass it around. 

I didn't see those examples previously since I hadn't tried passing anything except objects/strings, so I incorrectly assumed that strings were the only valid param.

My guess is that only primitives are allowed? Will dig into it more Monday though.
@russelldc

Hey @Patrick-Erichsen , sorry it took so long to get back to you on this -- your response had coincided with my vacation!

Yeah, I think it would be best to simply revert it back to `any`.
I came to the same conclusion after digging through the source, examples, docs and GH issues.


I also found this in the docs just now, for what it's worth:
https://github.com/gregnb/mui-datatables/blame/master/README.md#L315
```js
// `customBodyRender` is called with these arguments:

function(value: any, tableMeta: {
  rowIndex: number,
  ...
```
Hey @russelldc, not a problem. I'm okay with reverting the prop back to `any`, and I've opened a PR to do so here -> https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/49048.
